meanings.definition: A final demand or statement of terms, the rejection of which will result in retaliation or a breakdown in relations.
meanings.sent1: She gave him an ultimatum to either clean his room or lose his video game privileges.
meanings.sent2: The boss issued an ultimatum to the employees to meet the deadline or face consequences.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed as if giving an ultimatum for more treats before bedtime.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds seemed to deliver an ultimatum, warning of an impending downpour.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's ultimatum echoed in the classroom, emphasizing the importance of completing the assignment on time.
